There are $n$ schools numbered from 1 to $n$.  You can travel between any two schools by buying a ticket. The cost of a ticket between schools $i$ and $j$ is $a_{ij}$ and can be used multiple times.  Find the minimum cost to visit all the schools, starting and ending at any school. 


Input:

The first line contains an integer $n$ (1 ≤ $n$ ≤ 10⁵) — the number of schools.

Output:

Print a single integer: the minimum cost of tickets needed to visit all schools.
You are given a number of locations.  You can travel between any two locations for a given cost.  Find the least amount of money needed to visit every location at least once.
